storagemanager
Class StorageManager

java.lang.Object
  storagemanager.StorageManager

public abstract class StorageManager
extends java.lang.Object

This class is to implement XML-based Storage Manager. This storage manager does not exploit buffer manager to user.

Author:
dpatanroi

toByteArray

public byte[] toByteArray(java.util.BitSet bits)
Returns a byte array of at least length 1. The most significant bit in the result is guaranteed not to be a 1 (since BitSet does not support sign extension). The byte-ordering of the result is big-endian which means the most significant bit is in element 0. The bit at index 0 of the bit set is assumed to be the least significant bit.

Parameters:
bits -
Returns:

fromByteArray

public static java.util.BitSet fromByteArray(byte[] bytes)
Returns a bitset containing the values in bytes. The byte-ordering of bytes must be big-endian which means the most significant bit is in element 0.

Parameters:
bytes -
Returns:

public abstract void sysReadPage(int pageNumber,
                                 byte[] bytePage)

allocatePage

public int allocatePage()
This method calls sysAllocatePage and increases corresponding user counts. This method also increases user counts for page allocated.

Returns:
Page number of available page.

deallocatePage

public void deallocatePage(int pageNumber)
This method uses sysDeallocatePage to deallocate specified pageNumber. This method also increases user counts for page deallocated.

Parameters:
pageNumber - Page number to be deallocated.

public byte[] readPagewithoutPin(int pageNumber)
                          throws java.io.IOException
This method returns the requested page. This method also increases disk counts for page access.

Parameters:
pageNumber - Page number to be read.
Returns:
the content of the requested page (byte array)
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readPageandPin

public byte[] readPageandPin(int pageNumber)
                      throws java.io.IOException
The method returns the requested page, increases the disk counts, and also increases the pin count of the buffer mapping to that PageNumber.

Parameters:
pageNumber - the Page Number to be read
Returns:
the content of the requested page (byte array)

java.io.IOException

                         throws java.io.IOException

Parameters:
pageNum - Page number to be written.
page - Page content to be written.

java.io.IOException

writePageandPin

public void writePageandPin(int pageNum,
                            byte[] page)
                     throws java.io.IOException
This method writes the contents of a page into a buffer, increases the disk counts, and also increases the pin count of the buffer mapping to that PageNumber.

Parameters:
pageNum - Page number to be written.
page - The page content to be written
Throws:
java.io.IOException

pinPage

public void pinPage(int pageNum)
             throws java.io.IOException
The method pins a page in the Buffer Manager, which means to increase the pincount of the corresponding buffer by 1. Note: this method must be used with unpinPage(pageNum) in pair. Otherwise, some space in the buffer manager cannot be reused any more.

Parameters:
pageNum - The pageID to be pinned
Throws:
java.io.IOException

unpinPage

public void unpinPage(int pageNum)
               throws java.io.IOException
The method unpins a page in the Buffer Manager, which means to decrease the pincount of the corresponding buffer by 1.

Parameters:
pageNum - The pageID to be unpinned
Throws:
java.io.IOException

writePageforPagination

public void writePageforPagination(int pageNum)
                            throws java.io.IOException
This method writes a page so that it will be sent for "need to be written buffer". The method is only used by PaginationSAXParser.

Parameters:
pageNum - Page number to be written.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

flushBuffer

public void flushBuffer()
                 throws java.io.IOException
This method writes all dirty pages to disk.

java.io.IOException
